segments.text: Mike test 1, 2, 3.
Mike test 1, 2, 3.
I'm in the process of conducting an interview with somebody dealing with the assassination of John F. Kennedy.
My name is Eugene Sepulveda.
Today is March the 12th, 1980.
This is another volume test, just another volume.
Okay, but were you in the rank of a detective or were you in the rank of a policeman?
Eight years as a detective, two years as a lieutenant detective.
Okay, just so could I have this again?
If this is correct, if this is correct, please correct me.
Name's John B. Evans.
You're 33 and a half years of the policeman, eight years of the detective, and two years of the lieutenant detective.
Is that correct?
No.
Okay.
All in criminal investigation bureau, they call it.
That's the department here.
All right.
Can you just kind of start off like we started talking yesterday?
Yeah.
Have you got that thing on?
Yeah.
Okay.
My name is John B. Evans.
I am 64 years of age.
I've been born in 1916.
And I predicate what I am about to say on the
experience in the field of criminal investigation which had a tenure of in excess of 33 years in the fifth largest city in the United States.
Which was?
Houston, Texas.
Let me say that in my experience I have found

from the institution of criminal investigation all the way through the courts that a necessary item for any human being old enough to answer for his or her acts must be that they would be sane at the time of the commission of the act
and aware of the consequences in the event the prosecution resulted as a punishment for such acts.
And the only exception for adult sane human beings
or adult beings would have to be insanity for which they could not be prosecuted because of their condition.
They have no control over their acts or are not conscious of what their acts might result in.
From the time that the
assassination of John Fitzgerald Kennedy, President of the United States of America in 1963 occurred in Dallas, Texas, I have had a theory from a criminal investigation that certain individuals
had certain motives which led to this assassination.
And I will begin with the individual whom I consider to have the prime motive of personal gain and prestige as a result of this incident.
And that would be, at that time, Vice President Lyndon Baines Johnson, whose motive

for personal gain and power and prestige would have been the presidency of the United States as it was incumbent upon the vice president in the event a president deceases while in office to assume the office of the president of the United States.

from observation of incidents a number of years prior to the assassination concerning Mr. Johnson and some other individuals and additional individuals after the fact of the assassination leads me to suspect
And I firmly believe that the other individuals involved in that case were George Parr, who was the alleged kingpin of politics in South Texas, namely Duval and Starr counties,
Lee Harvey Oswald, who was a former United States Marine and who, reliable information tells me, had received a dishonorable discharge from that arm of the military service.
And Jack Ruby,

who operated a series of questionable business establishments referred to ordinarily as strip-tease joints in Dallas, Texas implying the basic rules of criminal investigation wherein a motive is a necessary item
when you reach the prosecution stage, in any case, to obtain a conviction.
The afore stated George Parr, who was renowned to be a very close friend to the aforesaid Lyndon Baines Johnson for a long period of years,

was led by various investigative organizations including the Federal Bureau of Investigation and other private citizens to have arranged so that at an election in a contest for a state senatorship between Lyndon Baines Johnson
and Coke R. Stevenson, rather early in Johnson's career as a politician, that George Carr had arranged for the

election returns to be reported to the election central in Dallas, Texas after an election had been held on a Saturday until sometime the following Wednesday, by which time most of the votes which had been reported in the balance of the state
had had time to be fairly well canvassed before allowing the vote from Duval County to be reported to the election central in Dallas.
And prior to the reporting of Duval County vote, Colt Stevenson had a slight lead in the race over Lyndon Johnson
But Johnson would not concede the election until all of the boxers in the state were heard from, and that included Duval County.
After the votes were finally called in, reported by mail, or whatever means they were reported from Duval County,
Lyndon Johnson showed to have the 89-vote lead in the race for the senator's job in the statewide election.
And at that time, Colt Stevenson conceded the election to Lyndon Baines Johnson, and Johnson became a senator in the state of Texas.
Some years later, during the administration of Harry S. Truman as President of the United States, it came to pass, according to the news media's reports, concerning George Parr.
George Parr had been indicted

federal court on income tax evasion or falsification of his income tax report and uh... summarily tried and found guilty and assessed a penalty of ten years in federal prison but after the jury had found
par guilty, put the case on appeal, and sometime later received a presidential pardon from Harry S. Truman.
Harry Truman hailed from the state of Missouri
And no mention has ever been made publicly by anyone that Harry Truman and George Parr had ever heard of each other, much less know each other.
So I presume that the case was that they were strangers to each other, unknowns to each other.
Okay, can I stop you for a minute for a voice check?
Sure.
We're now resuming.
I'll just take a voice check and we're going to continue.
Now that Lyndon Johnson is no longer in debt to George Parr or the ballot box packing or stuffing,
which obtained him the senator's job, according to reports from the FBI and various citizens.
The contrary now held true that, uh, that Parr was indebted to Johnson ten years of his life.
In later years, after Johnson had worked his way up to Senate Majority Leader in the Senate and the presidential election was to come about in the year of 1960,

And the Democrat convention was held in San Francisco, California, wherein Johnson seeked the nomination of the Democrat party to run for president against Richard Milhouse Nixon, who the Republicans had nominated as their candidate.
Johnson failed to get the nomination and the nomination was given to John Fitzgerald Kennedy of Massachusetts.
And the feeling of the
party was that the state of Texas would be a necessary item of support in order for Kennedy to win the election.
And therefore, the position of candidacy for the vice presidency was submitted to Johnson and he accepted.
In 1958, I believe, Mr. George Parr, who still politically ruled Duval County, managed to get his hands on some of the county's school funds.

and was indicted by a state grand jury, tried in the state district court, found guilty of felony theft of school funds, assessed the then maximum penalty for felony theft in the first defense of 10 years to be served in what was then known as the
T.S.P.S.
Texas State Prison System.
This case was put on appeal and Parr remained free on appeal bond as the case wound its way through the Court of Criminal Appeals and would have ultimately gone to the state Supreme Court.
During the interim, the 1960 election, the President of the United States occurred, and John Fitzgerald Kennedy was elected President and then named Johnson Vice President of the United States.
To the best of my recollection of what occurred,
The inauguration of Kennedy and Johnson was on or about the 12th of January, 1961.
And sometime between the middle and the end of March that same year,
George Parr received presidential pardon from John Fitzgerald Kennedy, who was found dead.
All of these matters would of necessity appear in the official records of the government of the United States and state of Texas, official court records and so forth.
pertaining to these convictions and pardons.
Time proceeded on, and during the summer of 1963, the Democrat Party in the state of Texas became split into several different factions.
I believe there was about seven, all told.
And Lyndon Johnson calls the year of 1964 was to be a presidential election year again.
And it was reported in the news media that he had had a talk with President Kennedy

and at that time, Governor John B. Conley, governor of the state of Texas, to the effect that he and Johnson and the president should come to Texas on what he termed a fence-mending tour in order to get the Democrat Party all back into one corral.
These terms are used among Texas ranchers pertaining to cattle, but Texas politicians use the same terminology pertaining to voters.
And at first, because of some incidents which had occurred in Dallas, Texas, when
Adlai E. Stevenson, Sr., a senator from the state of Illinois, and a retired general by the name of Walker, who lived in Dallas, Texas, and several other rather prominent national figures.
The Democratic Party had attempted to make speeches in Dallas, Texas,
they received vegetables and eggs some sticks and stones directed at the speakers instead of any applause or exception of their speech also

Well, publicized at the time, General Walker had sustained a bullet hole in the picture window of his living room in his home in Dallas, Texas, and sustained a near miss from the bullet that put the hole there.
So that it was published by the news media, newspapers, radio and television.

John Connolly had advised against the President and the Vice President both coming to Texas at the same time, together, going to various municipalities in the state on this fence-mending tour because it was dangerous.
And especially the attitude of the people in Dallas, Texas.
But somehow Johnson, according to reports in the news media, persuaded the President and Governor Connolly that he and the President would not receive any such treatment even in Dallas.
So they decided to come to Dallas.

and immediately the news media began to publish stories about the anticipated visit of the President and the Vice President, detailing when they would be in each municipality that they were to visit, and publishing in the newspapers prominently displayed on the front pages
the planned motorcade route that they would follow through each of these municipalities as they progressed on their visitation.
These diagrams were also displayed on television quite frequently in each of these cities.
And so that it would be common knowledge to the
people who might want to have a chance to see their president and vice president and their governor all simultaneously be able to position themselves along these motorcade routes for that purpose.
prior to becoming governor of the state of Texas, John B. Connolly served as a cabinet level in Washington, D.C. in the capacity of Secretary of the Navy.
And during that tenure, Lee Harvey Oswald received his
dishonorable discharge from the Marine Corps.
And it has been publicized considerably that Oswald had written letters to John Connolly requesting that he as Secretary of the Navy review his case
and consider an upgrade from dishonorable to something more desirable in the way of a discharge, and that Oswald was ignored by Connolly.
During the summer and early fall, while all the publicity was going around to the news media,

across the state, possibly across the country, pertaining to the visit of the president and vice president and the governor of these municipalities, Lee Harvey Oswald, somehow, in spite of the reported sustenance of two homes, one in Fort Worth and one in Dallas,
without being employed at all, managed to defray the expense of making a trip to Mexico City.
And according to what has been published of the FBI report and the Warren report,
Oswald crossed the Rio Grande River at a small village called Roma, Texas, which is the connecting bridge between Starr County, the county seat of which is Rio Grande City, and Old Mexico.
This was also alleged to have been the route that he was traced in returning from Mexico City back to Dallas.
It was reported by both the FBI and the Warren Commission that Oswald was traced to the Cuban consulate in Mexico City, as well as the Russian consulate, but did not
hold any conversation, transact any business with anyone at either of these locations and return to Dallas, Texas.
There has been no mention made of any investigation which would clarify whether or not Oswald contacted anybody
north of the border of the Rio Grande and say in Starr County or Duval County en route to Mexico City and back by either the FBI or the Warren Commission.
At the time this was all going on in 1963, George Parr's nephew, Archer Parr,
was county sheriff in Starr County.
During this same period, Jack Ruby, the Gurley nightclub operator, for some mysterious reason, became
exceedingly friendly with a lot of members of the Dallas Police Department, or at least this is what they and the FBI and the Warren Commission all concur is fact.
And my experience as a municipal police officer taught me long ago that this is highly unusual for people in that type of business.
to do anything regarding police except try to avoid them.
Certainly not to be visiting the police station and getting well acquainted with the high ranking officials and all this.
Now, it is my belief that
Lee Harvey Oswald was afforded an opportunity by someone to have an opportunity to take revenge against John Connolly, not John Kennedy.
There has been nothing to indicate there be any motivation whatsoever
or Lee Harvey Oswald to want to kill John Kennedy.
But there is sufficient motive in the ignoring of his plea for help pertaining to his dishonorable discharge from John Connolly to cause an individual with a temperament that the
people who claim to know him said that Oswald had to try to assassinate John Connolly.
And John Connolly was struck by some of the bullets that were fired into the car in which he and Kennedy were riding.
Can I ask you a question?
Was the motorcade route that they traveled by the depository, was that pre-planned or was that a last-minute change?
The chief police of the city of Dallas at that time wrote a book, which is easily available to anybody that wants it, in almost any bookstore and certainly any library, stating that...

approximately 30 minutes before departure time for the motorcade with the President Kennedy and Vice President Johnson and Governor John Connolly and their wives had been changed around the motorcade, had been changed approximately 30 minutes prior to departure time
so that it went by the book storage building where Oswald was alleged to have shot the president.
And he was never able to determine who ordered this altering of the mocade route.
But the order did come,
The route was changed so that the motorcade did pass by that building.
Of course, I have not mentioned the motive of Jack Ruby for any part in the assassination.

But I have known many people of many religious organizations, and I have rather consistently found that there is still a great deal of animosity between Baptists and Catholics, and even more between Jews and Catholics.
And Al Smith was rejected by a Democrat state who elected to support Herbert Clark Hoover much heavier than they did Al Smith in 1928.
for the presidency of this country because Al Smith was Catholic and no other reason was ever given.
And that was the only Republican that was ever supported the majority of the voters in the state of Texas for the presidency since the state of Texas has been in existence as a state
The next one that ever was was Richard Nixon.
And his margin was not nearly as great as Hoover's.
Now the circumstances indicate to me that

Jack Ruby was in on the conspiracy for the purpose of making sure that Lee Harvey Oswald did not tell authorities too much in the event he got caught and wasn't killed in the process of what transpired.
And
That is exactly what he did.
And he became a common sight around the Dallas Police Station so that he could gain access to Oswald sufficient to allow him to hush him up by taking his life.
And when the transfer on a Sunday morning after the assassination from the Dallas City Police Station
to the Dallas County Jail was attempted.
Millions of people who were watching the proceedings live on television from that location can attest to the fact that that is exactly what Jack Ruby did.
And no one ever offered any
motive for Jack Ruby's actions other than that he just thought so much of the president of the United States that he decided to kill the man that was alleged to have killed him.
But this does not explain why a strip joint operator prior to any assassination or any threat of it or anything else on the president got himself so familiarized around the Dallas police station
that he could gain access to Oswald in the first place.
In so far as I have been able to determine what has been released in the way of even basic criminal investigative efforts,
on the part of either the FBI or the Warren Commission in the tracing of Oswald's movements to Mexico City and back and tracing the rifle which was alleged to have been the murder weapon
and which was reportedly left behind in the book storage building to Lee Harvey Oswald and making ballistics tests and checking this weapon for fingerprints.
Other elements of

The criminal investigation appeared to me to be rather nil, and no one ever did offer any true motivation on the part of Oswald having taken the life of the president, or even attempting the life of his own son.
The only explanation that has ever been said that I've heard is the possible links of KGB because of his departure to Russia.
And what is your opinion on that?
The belief was that Oswald appeared to be, from these accounts, Oswald was linked to the Russian KGB and
This was supposed to have been determined by the CIA prior to what transpired in Dallas, but no tail was placed on Lee Harvey Oswald at that time to see what he was doing during this locating.
proceedings through the city of Dallas.

Isn't it common for anybody who has ever had anything to do with maybe even a threat to the president or with suspected links to the KGB to have Secret Service men around them or at least following them?
not only applies to the president, but all members of his family, the vice president, and all members of his family, and any serious candidate for the presidency at all.
This is besides...
the bodyguards of the candidate or the president themselves, but they do also, any person that they believe will threaten, isn't it usual that they will go and that they will watch that person?
It is my understanding that especially that during a time when there's a when the president or any member of his family is known to be in the
proximity of any individual who might be believed to be a foreign agent, a spy, would certainly be placed under very close surveillance, at least during that time.
It would be a special effort to keep them under closer than normal surveillance by FBI, CIA, Secret Service, all of them.
But I noticed that after Lyndon Johnson was deceased, George Parr got tangled up in another theft business case and was tried and found guilty again and assessed
prison term.
What was this other case, can you say?
This other case after Linda Johnson's death, what was this other case?
I believe it was something pertaining to the county treasury funds in Duval County.
At any rate, they found him dead where he

According to the investigation that followed that, the victim of suicide, since there was no way of getting another presidential pardon, because Johnson was no longer around, there wasn't anybody to prevail upon any president then to give him a pardon.
It was a suicide.
This, uh,
which further convinces me that Johnson was engineering the two presidential pardons that he did get.
Were you ever a patrolman in Starr County yourself?
Have I ever been there?
Have you ever been a patrolman in Starr County?
Never been a patrolman there.
I was a soldier there.
At the time that Ruby Clifton had gone to Mexico, is there any knowledge of him having stopped before he had crossed the border?
I have never heard anything pertaining to that whatsoever.

Nothing stipulated that any effort was made on the part of the FBI or the Warren Commission, either one, to see if he did actually stop in Rio Grande City or figure off through Duval County or some other place and make any contact with anybody.
There's never been anything published saying that he did, and nothing published saying that he didn't.
But there was certainly every opportunity in the world for him to have done so because he had to go directly through Rio Grande City.
And wasn't that the only bridge, the only access to Mexico through that route at that time?
That is the, between, I believe, well, it was then, and I think still is,
next place west or northwest on the Rio Grande that you could cross on a bridge after you leave Reynosa, McAllen and Reynosa.
I don't think there was another bridge until you got to Roma at that time and only one highway which
ran right through the middle of town, and the railroad track ran parallel to it up to Rio Grande City.
And there, there was a Y formed in the track so that the engines could turn around and go to the other end of the train and go back to Mission.
And having been stationed at Fort Ringgold, which was
an army post for the United States Cavalry, 1st Cavalry Division.
From August the 7th of 1940 to around the middle of February of 1941, I had an occasion to find out that that was the only road through there.
You've said
And I want to get it down.
What is your belief that why Johnson would accept the nomination for vice president?
Was it an ulterior motive?
Or why would Kennedy...
It would appear to me that since Johnson already held the position of Senate Majority Leader,

which was much more powerful and prestigious than that of Vice President, and second only to the President himself, that Johnson's only hope to ever be President, which he was seeking to be at the 1960 Democratic Convention, and made no bones about it,
that his only chance would be to become vice president and then the president when he was serving with the decision officer become incapable of carrying on the duties of the president.
Might also be noted that Judge Cyril T. Hughes was a federal judge who
for Ann Johnson as president aboard Air Force One in Dallas, Texas.
Some, according to the news media, 30 minutes after the president had been pronounced dead and that she was suggested
so the story goes, by Johnson to be nominated for the federal jet-ship by the president.
And she was appointed and was confirmed to the Senate.
Okay.
Is it you believe that without Johnson's support in Texas, Kennedy could have carried Texas?
I always figured that

because he was a Catholic more than any other, and the Great Baptist Belt runs through the heart of Texas and spreads almost to the borders in both directions, that he would have not had much better luck than Al Smith did.
Al Smith did not have a run in April, Texas.

I want it to be known that this is my analysis of this case, what I've been able to learn about it, what has been published and printed by the news media and what has been released by the Warren Commission.
